intro: Unonopsis veneficiorum, commonly known as the toxic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant is notable for its toxic properties, containing compounds that can be harmful if ingested. Its leaves are typically broad and heart-shaped, while its stems are often hairy and upright. Due to its toxicity, it is often found in shaded, moist environments where it can thrive without being disturbed.
